sentences.en: A clap of thunder reverberated through the house.
sentences.cn: 一声雷鸣在屋子里回响.

sentences.en: A swift clap of thunder woke me.
sentences.cn: 一阵突然的雷鸣把我惊醒.

sentences.en: A violent , earth - shattering clap of thunder immediately followed.
sentences.cn: 崖峻岭都给雷声震得沉重地颤抖.

sentences.en: an ear-splitting clap of thunder
sentences.cn: 震耳欲聋的雷声

sentences.en: Come on everyone, let’s give Tommy a clap.
sentences.cn: 来吧各位，我们为汤米鼓鼓掌吧。

sentences.en: He drank his ale and stood up ready to clap.
sentences.cn: 他喝了一口啤酒,坐直身子准备鼓掌.

sentences.en: I was awakened by a frightful clap of thunder.
sentences.cn: 我被一声可怕的雷声惊醒.

sentences.en: Let's give her a big clap, ie applaud her.
sentences.cn: 咱们给她用力鼓掌.

sentences.en: Let's give her a big clap.
sentences.cn: 我们给她用力鼓掌.

sentences.en: Let's give the children a big clap.
sentences.cn: 让我们为孩子们热烈鼓掌.

sentences.en: Mandy laughed and clapped her hands in delight.
sentences.cn: 曼迪笑了，高兴得拍起手来。

sentences.en: most countries clapped on tariffs to protect their farmers.
sentences.cn: 大多数国家强征关税以保护本国农民利益。

sentences.en: Narouz clapped his hands and a servant entered.
sentences.cn: 纳鲁兹拍了拍手，一名佣人走了进来。

sentences.en: On the basis of the Britain law, clap is especially innocent.
sentences.cn: 根据英国法律, 哈拍特无罪.

sentences.en: One man began to clap, and others joined in.
sentences.cn: 一个人鼓起了掌，其他人也跟着鼓掌。

sentences.en: She clapped her hands in delight.
sentences.cn: 她高兴地拍起手来。

sentences.en: She gives him a clap on the back.
sentences.cn: 她在他的背上拍了一下.

sentences.en: Sometimes people will clap wildly after you dance.
sentences.cn: 有时候,你跳完舞后人们会疯狂地鼓掌.

sentences.en: That's probably the most bare and bleak island I've ever had the misfortune to clap eyes on.
sentences.cn: 那可能是我不幸看到的最光秃、最荒凉的岛屿。

sentences.en: The audience clapped politely but without much enthusiasm.
sentences.cn: 观众礼貌地鼓了掌，但并不热烈。

sentences.en: The captain ordered his men to clap on more sail.
sentences.cn: 船长命令船员多张帆.

sentences.en: The couple were cheered and clapped on their arrival.
sentences.cn: 这对夫妇抵达时人群为他们欢呼鼓掌。

sentences.en: The lightning was followed by a fearful clap of thunder.
sentences.cn: 闪电之后是一阵可怕的雷声.

sentences.en: While Onassis might clap a friend on the back, Niarchos would extend a businesslike hand.
sentences.cn: 奥纳西斯可能会拍拍朋友的后背，可尼亚尔霍斯却会公事公办地伸出手来。

trans.tran_en: the loud sound that you make when you hit your hands together many times to show that you enjoyed something
to hit your hands against each other many times to make a sound that shows your approval, agreement, or enjoyment

trans.tran_cn: 拍手，鼓掌，急速放置，轻拍
trans.tran_en: to hit your hands against each other many times to make a sound that shows your approval, agreement, or enjoyment
if you clap your hands, you hit your hands together a few times to attract someone’s attention or to show that you are pleased
